snippet: A Pakistani Taliban commander was quoted as saying that the targets were tribal elders who had helped organize a militia to resist Taliban encroachment in the area.
abstract: Car bomb rips through town bazaar in northwestern Pakistan’s tribal belt, killing 11 people and wounding at least 31 others; Pakistani Taliban claims responsibility.
lead_paragraph: A Pakistani Taliban commander was quoted as saying that the targets were tribal elders who had helped organize a militia to resist Taliban encroachment in the area.

headline.main: Bazaar Bomb Claimed by Taliban Kills at Least 11 in Northwest Pakistan
